info.name: Accessory nucleus
info.description: The accessory nucleus (sometimes referred to as the spinal accessory nucleus) is located in the lateral aspect of the ventral horn at C 1 - C5.  It consists of the lower motor neurons that innervate the sternocleidomastoid and trapezius muscles.  Unlike other motor neurons in the ventral horn, the axons of these neurons exit the lateral aspect of the spinal cord dorsal to the denticulate ligaments, as they form the accessory nerve (11th cranial nerve).
info.item: /Sections/Thin, Spinal Cord to Cerebrum/9 Cord-Medulla Junction
